meanings.definition: A person who slaughters animals for food.
meanings.sent1: The butcher at the farm is skilled at preparing meat.
meanings.sent2: I bought some fresh sausages from the local butcher.
meanings.sent3: The butcher accidentally cut his finger while sharpening his knife.
meanings.sent4: The butcher of the family, Uncle Bob, always grills the best steaks.
meanings.sent5: The butcher's shop was filled with the aroma of smoked ham.

meanings.sent1: Farmers butcher animals to provide meat for their families.
meanings.sent2: The chef will butcher the chicken before cooking it.
meanings.sent3: I tried to butcher the fish, but it ended up in pieces everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The hunters butchered the deer swiftly and efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The butchered pig was divided into different cuts for sale.

meanings.definition: To kill someone brutally or indiscriminately.
meanings.sent1: The villain planned to butcher his enemies in revenge.
meanings.sent2: The serial killer would butcher his victims without remorse.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie depicted a crazed killer who liked to butcher his victims.
meanings.sent4: The dictator's regime butchered innocent civilians in the name of power.
meanings.sent5: The gang members decided to butcher their rival gang in a violent showdown.

meanings.sent1: I accidentally butchered the cake I was baking.
meanings.sent2: The comedian butchered his jokes during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The student managed to butcher the presentation with wrong information.
meanings.sent4: The team's poor strategy butchered their chances of winning the game.
meanings.sent5: The writer felt like he butchered the ending of his novel.
